content.raw:
I think it it didn't tend to bounce in ODE with the joint limit motor, but with SetVelocityMaximal it is bouncing. It was also bouncing in bullet, but the test was disabled.

To be honest, I think `EXPECT_[GL]T` is a more reasonable expectation for this test on joint limits. `EXPECT_NEAR` implies an inelastic collision. I think we should only do `EXPECT_NEAR` in a test that's focusing on the `stop_erp`, `stop_cfm`, and similar parameters
content.html:
I think it it didn't tend to bounce in ODE with the joint limit motor, but with SetVelocityMaximal it is bouncing. It was also bouncing in bullet, but the test was disabled.

To be honest, I think EXPECT_[GL]T is a more reasonable expectation for this test on joint limits. EXPECT_NEAR implies an inelastic collision. I think we should only do EXPECT_NEAR in a test that's focusing on the stop_erp, stop_cfm, and similar parameters
